intro: Hazunta modesta subvar. montana, commonly known as the mountain hazunta, is a perennial shrub native to the temperate regions of North America. It typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are small, clustered, and range in color from white to pale pink. This subvariety is valued for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to various garden conditions.
